title: Wayne Rooney keeps things casual with Kai during family holiday in Barbados
text:
The Rooney clan - sans Coleen - have jetted to Barbados for their annual family jaunt.

And Wayne Rooney enjoyed a fun day out with his son Kai during their beach holiday on Saturday, where his eldest son, nine, showed off his impressive football skills.

The professional footballer, 34, was ready for summer as he donned a sleet grey T-Shirt over a pair of black shorts that had a colourful turtle-print design.

Beach ready: Wayne Rooney kept things casual in a grey shirt and turtle-print shorts during the family's sun-soaked trip to Barbados on Saturday

Sportsman: Son Kai, 9, showed off his football skills during family holiday in Barbados

Wayne completed his look by wearing a pair of Givenchy sandals, while he protected himself from the brilliant summer sun in a baseball cap and aviator shades.

Meanwhile Kai was the spitting image of his father, as he showed off his skills with a football by kicking it around and heading the ball with ease.

The youngster looked sweet in a graphic-print T-Shirt, which had a distorted image of a stone bust on the front, and blue floral shorts.

Wayne's son Kit, 3, was also enjoyed the sun, sea and sand as he played in the ocean with Coleen's mother Colette, who looked stylish in a pink summer dress.

Sporty: Kai was the spitting image of his father, as he showed off his skills with a football by kicking it around and heading the ball with ease

Sweet: Wayne's son Kit, 3, was also enjoyed the sun, sea and sand as he played in the ocean with Coleen's mother Colette, who looked stylish in a pink summer dress.

Doting dad: Wayne chatted away to Kit as he walked through the ocean

Coleen, 33, has remained at home as she recovers from an infection.

Coleen was struck down with the infection in the wake of the ongoing drama with fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy.

On Thursday, she took to Instagram where she wished her husband a happy 34th birthday.

The WAG posted a sweet snap of the footballer taken at Universal Studios in Orlando with their four sons Kit Klay, six, Kai and Cass, 20 months.

Wow: Kai looked in good spirits as he showed off his football skills

Header: Kai did a header as he showed off his footballing prowess

Fun: Kai looked delighted as he showed off his footballing skills

Alongside a snap of Wayne and his boys, Coleen wrote: 'Happy Birthday @WayneRoone ... have a brilliant day with our boys!! All our love always xxx'.

On Sunday, Coleen first broke her silence and tweeted for the first time since her war of words with Rebekah erupted after she accused her of selling stories about her to the press.

Uploading a shot of her youngest child, Coleen explained she has had to remain in the UK.

'Lovely morning in the fresh air with Cass,' she posted on Sunday evening. 'We had planned to be with the rest of our family in Barbados for half term break.

Cute: Coleen and Wayne's son Kit, three, enjoyed some special time with grandmother Colette

Cute: Kit planted a kiss on his grandmother during the fun day at the beach

'Unfortunately I became poorly with an infection before we were due to leave. I am not able to join them for the time being, even though I am feeling better [sic]'

The tweet came as Wayne was spotted touching down in Barbados on Sunday to join his three other children for their trip, before joining friends and family on the beach near their home on the Caribbean island.

The football star arrived a few days after his sons, who jetted over with their grandparents Colette and Anthony McLoughlin, Coleen's parents.

While her family soaked up the sun in the Caribbean, Coleen and her youngest son Cass enjoyed a 'lovely morning in the fresh air' in a local park.

Chic: He protected himself from the brilliant summer sun in a baseball cap and aviator shades

Designer items: Wayne completed his look by wearing a pair of Givenchy sandals

Chilled out: Wayne looked relaxed as he walked around the resort

Walking around: Wayne enjoyed a relaxing stroll along the sandy beaches

Earlier this month, Coleen claimed Rebkah Vardy had been leaking stories from her private Instagram to The Sun newspaper

Meanwhile, Coleen's dramatic revelation enthralled Britain and sparked an angry denial from pregnant Rebekah, following claims that she had been selling stories.

She said 'I don't need the money’ and pointed out other people have had access to her Instagram account.

Rebekah recently gave an interview with The Daily Mail, in which she insisted arguing with Coleen is akin to rowing 'with a pigeon.'

Tribute: Coleen wished her husband Wayne a happy 34th birthday on Thursday as they were forced to spend the day apart

One on one: Coleen posted a snap of little Cass in a local park and told her fans the pair had enjoyed a 'lovely morning in the fresh air'

Cancelled: The WAG, 33, told her Twitter followers she was home in the UK with her youngest son Cass, 20 months, recovering after falling 'poorly with an infection'

Jamie Vardy's wife was pictured returning to the UK in floods of tears after the scandal broke while she herself was on holiday with her football star football Jamie.

She was supported by Jamie as she returned to London's Heathrow Airport from a family trip to Dubai on Saturday.

In the emotional pictures, Rebekah is seen struggling to hide her tears as she made her way through the busy airport hand-in-hand with husband Jamie.

Feud: Earlier this month, Coleen claimed the pregnant star had been leaking stories from her private Instagram to The Sun newspaper

The statement: Coleen made these claims on Instagram on October 9 after discovering she had been betrayed by someone close to her and she concluded that it was Rebekah's account

Wag-atha Christie: Coleen tweeted these words back in January, highlighting how she has been trying to get to the bottom of who was leaking stories on her life for some time

Fans have praised Rooney – calling her ‘Wagatha Christie’ - for the sensational way in which she revealed Vardy was the alleged culprit by concluding her post with a thriller-worthy 'It's......... Rebekah Vardy's account.'

The saga began when Coleen took to social media to reveal she had suspected someone close to her had been betraying her for years and she had conclusive proof that her friend Rebekah was the guilty party.

Vardy is a queen of self-promotion who has risen to the top rank of footballers wives from humble beginnings - the daughter of a BBC local radio DJ and a window cleaner father who has two ex husbands.

Shock: Rebekah was accused by Coleen of leaking stories about her to The Sun newspaper, which the expectant I'm A Celebrity star has fiercely denied (pictured in June 2016)

Serious: The feuding pair are said to be communicating through their lawyers in the wake of the bitter row which has dominated social media and newspapers this week

Before meeting current husband Jamie, she was working in a Sheffield nightclub and dating a Vauxhall conference football player who has previously accused her of ditching him to 'trade up' to Premier League star.

Coleen admitted that stories about her basement flooding, returning to TV and gender selection were only viewed by Rebekah and these were subsequently followed by media outlets, including MailOnline.

The Sun has since removed their story about Coleen's basement flooding after discovering she had made it up.
description: The professional footballer, 34, enjoyed a fun day out with his son Kai during their beach holiday on Saturday, where his eldest son, nine, showed off his impressive football skills.
